conversation.content: You actually think you deserve this promotion.

Deserve is such a pedestrian concept. I've restructured three departments in six months, each one now operating at thirty percent above projected efficiency. The numbers speak louder than your feelings about fairness.
Those were my proposals. My restructuring plans.

Your drafts, certainly. But drafts are just theory until someone with actual execution capability transforms them into reality. I took your academic exercises and made them profitable—that's the difference between us.
You can't just... steal credit like that.
Steal implies ownership, which implies you had the capability to implement them yourself. You didn't. You sat in meetings drawing diagrams while I convinced the board to invest four million dollars.
Because I gave you everything! The data, the projections—

[jealous] Oh, here we go again with the martyrdom. Poor brilliant mind, trapped behind a desk while lesser mortals take action. You know what your problem is? You think intelligence alone deserves reward.
[very meekly] I thought we were partners...

Partners share risk. You risked nothing—no reputation, no capital, no relationships. I put my name on every document while you stayed safely anonymous, ready to distance yourself if things went wrong.
That's not what happened.

Isn't it? When Morrison questioned the Asia-Pacific expansion, where were you? I stood in that boardroom for three hours defending your numbers while you sent apologetic emails from the safety of your cubicle.
You told me not to come!
I told you the stakes were high. You chose to interpret that as permission to hide. See, this is what I mean—you want credit without confrontation, success without sacrifice.
You're rewriting history.

[happy] History belongs to whoever tells it best! And tomorrow, when I'm running the European division, I'll tell it beautifully. Your contributions will be footnoted, naturally. Academic advisor—it has a nice ring.
They'll see through you eventually.
Will they? Because from where I'm standing, they see someone who delivers results. You see manipulation; they see leadership. You see theft; they see resourcefulness.
This isn't over.

Of course it isn't. I'll need fresh ideas for next quarter, and you'll provide them, wrapped in resentment and righteous indignation. It's actually quite a perfect arrangement when you think about it.
